learning_outcomes.description: Critically evaluate and synthesisecontemporary organisational psychology theory and research tojustifycoherent problem definitions within relevant social, political, and economic contexts.

Identifyculturally responsive, evidence-based, reliable and valid organisationalassessmentmethods at the individual, team, and/or organisational levels using appropriate methodologies andjustifytool selection.
Synthesisemultiple data sources into acoherent organisational case conceptualisation/diagnosistoprioritiseissues andselectevidence-informed options.

Design and justifyculturally safe, feasibleorganisational interventions(e.g., selection systems, training and development, job/organisation redesign, safety and wellbeing, climate change, coaching), informed by theory, context, and stakeholder needs.
Plan and appraiseimplementation and evaluation strategies (e.g., logic models, KPIs, process/outcome measures).
Communicatediagnostic insights, recommendations, and evaluation plans inprofessional written and oral formatstailored to diverse stakeholders, usingculturally appropriate language.
Demonstrateethical, collaborative, and competency-aware practice (e.g., record-keeping, consultation/referral, and self-care).

assessments.assessment_title: Presentation of an Applied Org Problem
assessments.due_date: Presentation date to be determined in class
assessments.task_description: Select a specific problem of interest to you from one of the broad content areas in organisational psychology. The problem should be focussed, concrete, and realistic (consult with the Course Co-ordinator before you finalise the topic). Next, research the literature relevant to this problem and develop an understanding of the causes, nature and consequences of the problem. Use these insights to propose a solution. Try to make the solution 'implementable'; do not give in to simplistic solutions. This exercise will form the basis of a class presentation (40% of the grade) and a written paper (40% of the grade). For more details including the requirement for a short written reflection about your presentation experiences, please see the guidelines and criteria documents on blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your PPT, resources, and reflection via turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Report on Solution to an Applied Org Problem
assessments.task_description:
Using the same problem on which you presented for your presentation assessment, draft a written report outlining and justifying your problem concepualisation, theoretical underpinning, assessment methodology, intervention plan and evalation strategy. The report must be grounded in the peer reviewed organisational psychology literature and written for an organisational psychology academic expert. Please see further information and marking criteria on blackboard.


Please note - the purpose of the report and the presentation is to develop your knowledge of organisational psychology. As a result, you must not do the report/ present in an area that was covered in your Honours project or that you are submitting as part of your PhD, dissertation, or other coursework/practicum subjects.
